name: Gibbering Mouther
lore: A gibbering mouther is a horrifying amalgamation of eyes, mouths, and liquefied flesh that babbles incoherently while oozing forward to consume any creature it encounters. Born from the union of aberrant magic and organic matter, each mouth mutters, shrieks, and gibbers, creating a cacophony that unravels the minds of those who hear it. The ground beneath its amorphous form warps and softens, impeding creatures that draw near.

traits.name: Aberrant Ground
traits.description: The ground in a 10-foot Emanation around the mouther is Difficult Terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have its Speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Gibbering
traits.description: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't Incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't take Reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls 1d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if no creature is within reach.

multiattack.description: The mouther makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach 5 ft. Hit: 7 (2d6) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Blinding Spittle
actions.description: The mouther spits a glob of chemical goo at a point it can see within 15 feet of itself. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or have the Blinded condition until the end of the mouther's next turn.

savingThrow.targets: each creature in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point

conditions.duration: until the end of the mouther's next turn
until the end of the mouther's next turn
